column4: anybody there to tell me about solving problem in external hdd
it depends on what the problem is....
what is the problem with the drive?
can you look in your /etc/fstab and see if the drive is listed? For example, if it's mounted on /media disk, see if /media/disk is in your fstab?
go to a terminal and type less /etc/fstab. when you're done looking at it, q quits
do you see /media/disk (or /media/anything?)
ok...it's a USB drive, right?
can you type ls /dev/sd  and then hit the tab key twice and tell me what it says?

ok...whatever. That's weird. Try this: Go into gconf-editor and navigate to /system/storage/default_options/vfat/mount_options , and then remove the "usefree" option from the list. Exit gconf-editor, and try hotplugging your drive again (from http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=582045)
so you need to open a terminal and type gconf-editor
try plugging the drive in again
does it come up?
ok, that's good...did it automount the drive?
go to Panel -> Places -> computer and see if it shows up.
ok. from the same web page I found this:  First I removed "usefree". It did nothing.
hello, any luck?
what kind of computer is it?
laptop? Desktop?
ok...some laptops have issues with USB...that's not your problem though
yes?
I'm googling....
try this link....http://www.linux-usb.org/FAQ.html#ts6  anything useful there?
